ModuleDescription: Using an interdisciplinary approach, this class will explore the environmental, economic, and social dimensions of resilience, which is currently a common term used to describe a range of development initiatives. The potential opportunities, challenges, and disadvantages of using the notion of resilience to address a range of urban challenges will be discussed, as will the practical implications of a development re-set to the goal of resilience. The overall goal of the course is to develop critical thinking skills and practical analytical and evaluation skills with respect to development initiatives framed by a commitment to resilience.
Prerequisite: One of the following modules: YSS2220 Introduction to Urban Studies, YID1201 Introduction to Environmental Studies, YSS2224 Introduction to Global Affairs
Corequisite: One of the following modules: YSS2220 Introduction to Urban Studies, YID1201 Introduction to Environmental Studies, YSS2224 Introduction to Global Affairs
